verb.description: Assault or abuse (a person, especially a woman or child) sexually.
examples: he was charged with molesting and taking obscene photographs of a ten-year-old boy

verb.description: Pester or harass (someone) in an aggressive or persistent manner.
examples: the crowd was shouting abuse and molesting the two police officers

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense cause trouble to, vex): from Old French molester or Latin molestare annoy, from molestus troublesome.
